alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 10 at 10:16AM MDT until June 16 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Great Falls MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Gallatin River near DCP-Gallatin R/Gateway affecting Gallatin County. Gallatin River at Logan affecting Gallatin County. .A combination of moderate to heavy rainfall and snowmelt will cause rises on the Gallatin River late this weekend and early next week. The cold and fast flowing water could pose life threatening danger to those in and near the water. For the Gallatin River...including DCP-Gallatin R/Gateway, Logan... flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Gallatin River near DCP-Gallatin R/Gateway. * WHEN...From late Sunday night to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor roads in gallatin gateway covered with water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Friday the stage was 4.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Monday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
